subject: Dunk & Egg Ride Again
event: Circle October 6 on your calendar. My friends at Bantam have just informed me that will be the day that A KNIGHT OF THE SEVEN KINGDOMS in released in English, collecting all three of my "Dunk & Egg" novellas -- "The Hedge Knight," "The Sworn Sword," and "The Mystery Knight" -- between one set of covers for the first time. Many of you, of course, will have read the adventures of Ser Duncan the Tall and his squire Egg in their original appearances in LEGENDS, LEGENDS II, and WARRIORS. But A KNIGHT OF THE SEVEN KINGDOMS will have a lot more than the three stories. We wanted this to be an illustrated book, so we went to the amazing Gary Gianni and asked him to do some art for us, thinking perhaps we could include seven or eight interior illustrations. Gary turned us down. He loved the stories, he said, but he'd only do it if he could illustrate the entire book, with art on virtually every page. We said yes, of course, and Gary has been drawing for the better part of two years. Most fantasy fans know Gianni's artwork from his work on PRINCE VALIANT, on the Wandering Star limited editions of SOLOMON KANE and BRAN MAK MORN, and of course for his stunning 2014 ICE & FIRE calendar, but we think A KNIGHT OF THE SEVEN KINGDOMS may be his best work to date. This is going to be an amazing book, one I will be very happy to have my name on -- beside that of Gary Gianni, surely among the very best fantasy artists of all time. (And damn it, folks, it is LONG past time that he was nominated for a Hugo).

comments.article: fantastic! when and where can I pre order mine?

Appropos of Dunk and Egg, I look forward to some of the stories hinted at in "The World of Ice and Fire". Especially the last one in the series.

I also look forward to this one.

This is wonderful news. I have just started reading A Dance With Dragons, so once I'm finished with that and A World of Ice and Fire, this'll make another great addition into the heart of this newly born Ice and Fire fan.

Diggin' the cover-art on this one, George!!

It may be too early (and as such, you may not be able to answer), but will the book feature Appendices like the 'main' books of the Ice and Fire series??

I will most likely place a pre-order this week coming sometime, even though it's coming a long ways off! [I would for Winds as well, if I could]
comments.subject: Impressive Cover!

comments.article: Oh, i need this. A lot. Consider October 6 circled.
Yessssssssssssssssssssssss.
comments.subject: My money is already yours

comments.article: Already pre-ordered from Amazon! Not only have I not had the pleasure of reading these stories before (despite my love of ASoIaF), I also can't resist any illustrations related to the wonderful universe you've created, George. I already love browsing art of your characters that pull more from the books than the TV show (not to say that the TV casting and acting aren't superb, just that age and many other factors prevent all the actors from looking like their book counterparts, to varying degrees). It really makes re-reading the books all that more fun and vivid. So I can't wait to discover these new characters with the help of what I'm sure will be some superb illustrations!

I'm now glad I haven't gotten around to reading the Dunk n' Egg stories because NOW I'll get all 3 WITH illustrations! (I'm a very fast reader so I tend to avoid short stories because it feels like eating only one potato chip)
I'll have to buy this one. I have a brazilian edition with the three stories, but no arts.
comments.subject: Dunk and Egg

comments.article: Excellent news!  Although I already have 1st editions of each of these, I'm really looking forward to adding this version to my collection.  Hopefully you will have some signed copies available through the Cocteau.
Can't wait! I have yet to read the novellas and I'm looking forward to once again losing myself in the wonderful world of Westeros.
comments.subject: Yay!

comments.article: Oh wow, I can't wait!

Two of my favorite things together. Very glad to hear this.

My man, you sure know how to ride in style.
very excited by this illustrated book
comments.subject: will wait for this in South America

comments.article: Yay! Though I bought on of the stories of Dunk & Egg in Brasil, it would be nice to have the complete stories.

i don't want to own the same story two or three times. I will wait until all the dunk and Egg stories are published individually, and then hopefully in a compilation, and get it then.

same with the Game of Thrones blurays. I will wait for the boxset when the series is done.

plus I have yet to crack Old Mars, Dangerous Women or The World of Ice and Fire, so lots on my plate.
comments.subject: The artwork sounds nice, but...

comments.article: Considering the size of the novellas, they're not going to be able to collect them all in one book.  These three collected by themselves will be the size of one of the novels.  The only realistic possible collection with all the future novellas will be a multi-volume collected edition, or of course a massive ebook.
comments.subject: Re: The artwork sounds nice, but...

comments.article: Is there going to be a graphic novel of Mystery Knight?
Yes

Well I did finish reading "The Hedge Knight" and "The Sworn Sword" a month ago for the first time, but I didn't get to read "The Mystery Knight" so far. I guess now I'm just going to wait till October to buy all three in one splendid book.
Still in the middle of reading "The World of Ice and Fire" and loving it very much. Thank you for your wonderful work George and take every time you need for the next books. :)

It's 90 years before A Game of Thrones. /pedant

Glad I already have the German version.

Lovely. I have the Solomon Kane and Bran Mak Morn editions with Gianni's illustratiions. Dunk and Egg will fit in just fine with Bran, Kull, Conan, Khlit the Kossack, Hugh of Taranto, Daril ibn Athir, and the whole merry gang of kings, knights, crusaders, steppe riders, and pirates from the worlds of Howard, Lamb and others of that ilk. I've got a whole shelf full of those stories.
... that you include an appendix in the book, like in the main ASoIaF series, depicting the main characters, and their relations to each other?
comments.subject: Any chance ...

comments.article: No, afraid not.
comments.subject: Re: Any chance ...

comments.article:
I think maybe the Brazilian edition was the first to put all three "Dunk & Egg" novellas between one set of covers for the first time.

comments.subject: Brazilian edition

comments.article: The D&E stories are fantastic. I can't wait for this book to come out as well as all the great artwork inside it.
comments.subject: Really pumped

comments.article: Is this the kind of hardcover that has a dust jacket or (like the worldbook) the kind without, and will it be in paperback eventually?
Yes, there will eventually be a paperback... but not until at least a year after the hardcover.  Maybe longer.
I'll definitely be buying this, but will I ever see a 'The Mystery Knight' graphic novel next to 'The Hedge Knight' and 'The Sworn Sword' on my bookshelf? I can't stand an unfinished series. :(
